it.emarolab.scene_identification_tracking.semanticSceneLibrary.objects.aMOR

Class MORPrimitive

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.emarolab.scene_identification_tracking.semanticSceneLibrary.objects.Semantics.Base
      • it.emarolab.scene_identification_tracking.semanticSceneLibrary.objects.aMOR.MORPrimitive
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Semantics, Semantics.Logger, Semantics.Primitive<MORDescriptor>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MOROrientable, MORSphere

    public class MORPrimitive
extends Semantics.Base
implements Semantics.Primitive<MORDescriptor>
    The java/semantic mapper for a Primitive Object, based on aMOR OWL references.

    It implements a two way mapping interface between this java structure and a semantic individual. Such a procedure is based on OWL data properties that reflect the fields of Semantics.Primitive, where the ontology interface is based on the MORDescriptor class.
    In particular, this implementation manages an individual (which name is described in the MORDescriptor) that has 5 OWL data properties. Three of them define the center of mass coordinates (see MOR3DArray.writeSemantics(MORDescriptor) and MOR3DArray.readSemantics(MORDescriptor)). While, the other two are optional and can be used to set semantically the object ID and creation time stamp (see shouldMapId(boolean), shouldMapTime(boolean) and isMapingId(), isMappingTime()).

    REMARK: see here for more about the aMOR library.

    File: it.emarolab.scene_identification_tracking.semanticSceneLibrary.objects.Semantics

    date: 06/01/2017
    See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • MORPrimitive

        public MORPrimitive(MORPrimitive primitive)
        Cloning constructor, create a new object as a clone of the input parameter.
        Parameters:
        primitive - the object to clone.

      • MORPrimitive

        public MORPrimitive(java.lang.String ontologyName,
                    long id)
        Construct this class with all invalidate fields. For instance, initially readSemantics() should be called.
        It sets a createDefaultSemantics(String) for this object based on the given input name. Also, it constructs the centroid by using MOR3DArray.MOR3DArray() and its property names ise set, for X, Y and Z, to; CENTROID_X_DATA_PROPERTY_NAME, CENTROID_Y_DATA_PROPERTY_NAME, and CENTROID_Z_DATA_PROPERTY_NAME respectively.
        Parameters:
        ontologyName - the name to an instantiated OWLReferences that will describe this object semantically.
        id - the unique identifier of this object.

      • MORPrimitive

        public MORPrimitive(java.lang.String ontologyName,
                    long id,
                    MOR3DArray centroid)
        Construct this class by specifying all its fields. For instance, initially writeSemantics() should be called.
        It sets a createDefaultSemantics(String) for this object based on the given input name. Also, the input centroid may already contains some property names (see MOR3DArray.hasXproperty(), MOR3DArray.hasYproperty() and MOR3DArray.hasZproperty()). If not, those are set as; CENTROID_X_DATA_PROPERTY_NAME, CENTROID_Y_DATA_PROPERTY_NAME, and CENTROID_Z_DATA_PROPERTY_NAME.
        Parameters:
        ontologyName - the name to an instantiated OWLReferences that will describe this object semantically.
        id - the unique identifier of this object.
        centroid - the coordinates of the center of mass of this object.

      • MORPrimitive

        public MORPrimitive(MORDescriptor semantic,
                    long id)
        Construct this class with all invalidate fields. For instance, initially readSemantics() should be called.
        In this constructor, the centroid is created as MOR3DArray.MOR3DArray() and its property names set, for X, Y and Z, as; CENTROID_X_DATA_PROPERTY_NAME, CENTROID_Y_DATA_PROPERTY_NAME, and CENTROID_Z_DATA_PROPERTY_NAME respectively.
        Parameters:
        semantic - the ontology interface for semantically map this object.
        id - the unique identifier of this object.

      • MORPrimitive

        public MORPrimitive(MORDescriptor semantic,
                    long id,
                    MOR3DArray centroid)
        Construct this class by specifying all its fields. For instance, initially writeSemantics() should be called.
        In this constructor, the input centroid may already contains some property names (see MOR3DArray.hasXproperty(), MOR3DArray.hasYproperty() and MOR3DArray.hasZproperty()). If not, those are set as; CENTROID_X_DATA_PROPERTY_NAME, CENTROID_Y_DATA_PROPERTY_NAME, and CENTROID_Z_DATA_PROPERTY_NAME.
        Parameters:
        semantic - the ontology interface for semantically map this object.
        id - the unique identifier of this object.
        centroid - the coordinates of the center of mass of this object.

    • Method Detail

      • createDefaultSemantics

        protected MORDescriptor createDefaultSemantics(java.lang.String ontologyName)
        It generate a new MOR semantic for this object by generating the name of the individual that will describe this object in an ontology.
        This method is called on constructors: MORPrimitive(String, long) and MORPrimitive(String, long, MOR3DArray)). Moreover, its returning value is set to the semantic described by this class (see: getSemantics()) during this object construction.
        Parameters:
        ontologyName - the name to an instantiated OWLReferences that will describe this object semantically.
        Returns:
        a new MORDescriptor for mapping thi object to/from an OWLOntology.

      • getDefaultIndividualName

        protected java.lang.String getDefaultIndividualName()
        It is called by createDefaultSemantics(String) and return the name of the semantic individual describing this class.
        Indeed, it set the name as the unique object identifier. Namely, it returns: String.valueOf( getID())
        Returns:
        the default name of the OWL individual describing this object in the ontology.

        public MORDescriptor getSemantics()
        Specified by:
        getSemantics in interface Semantics.Primitive<MORDescriptor>
        Returns:
        the object that is in charge to read and write in the ontology. It must be given not null in the constructor. For aMOR library, it mainly cares about the individual name, describing the object, and the reference name, describing the ontology.
        See Also:
        Primitive#getSemantics()

      • average

        public boolean average(Semantics.Primitive object)
        In particular, it checks if the input object is of the same shape of the this representation. Than, it replace the description of the centroid as the arithmetic average between the input parameter and this object.
        Specified by:
        average in interface Semantics.Primitive<MORDescriptor>
        Parameters:
        object - the coefficients object description to be averaged with this structure.
        Returns:
        false if an error occurs. True otherwise.

      • copy

        public Semantics.Primitive<MORDescriptor> copy()

        Specified by:

        Returns:

      • writeSemantics

        public Semantics.WritingState writeSemantics()
        Synchronise the java representation of this Primitive object with the ontology and return the process state.

        It is based on MOR3DArray.writeSemantics(MORDescriptor) for semantically map the coordinate of the center of mass in the ontology. Also, if this option has been enabled, it writes the unique identifier (getID()) and creation time stamp (getTime()) based on: getIdPropertyName() and getTimePropertyName(). The mapping of those latter properties of the objects are based on: MORDescriptor.writeLiteral(String, OWLDataProperty, OWLLiteral). Those writing process generate more writing states, that are merged in a single outcome based on: Semantics.WritingState#merge(WritingState).

        Specified by:
        writeSemantics in interface Semantics
        Returns:
        the state of this writing process.
        See Also:
        Primitive#writeSemantics(), MOR3DArray.writeSemantics(MORDescriptor), WritingState

      • readSemantics

        public Semantics.ReadingState readSemantics()
        Synchronise the ontology representation of a Primitive object with this java structure and return the process state.

        It is based on MOR3DArray.readSemantics(MORDescriptor) for semantically map the coordinate of the center of mass from the ontology. Also, if this option has been enabled, it reads the unique identifier (getID()) and creation time stamp (getTime()) based on: getIdPropertyName() and getTimePropertyName(). The mapping of those latter properties of the objects are based on: MORDescriptor.readLiteral(String, OWLDataProperty, OWLLiteral). Those reading process generate more reading states, that are merged in a single outcome based on: Semantics.ReadingState#merge(ReadingState).

        Specified by:
        readSemantics in interface Semantics
        Returns:
        the state of this reading process.
        See Also:
        Primitive#readSemantics(), MOR3DArray.readSemantics(MORDescriptor), ReadingState
